p: Mumps has been increasingly reported in the USA, with more than 10,000 cases reported in a large multistate outbreak in 2005–2006 [ 110– 116]. Patients present with acute onset of unilateral or bilateral parotitis; infection may be complicated by orchitis, oophoritis, pancreatitis, mastitis, meningitis, and encephalitis [ 117]. Infection may be diagnosed serologically or via PCR [ 118, 119]. No antivirals have been investigated in the treatment of mumps. Enhanced efforts at immunization against measles and mumps pretransplant as well as active surveillance posttransplant are warranted.
